values:
Sophie and I got engaged on Eastbourne Beach on the 19th December while we were down south for DMC6 - she got the full bended knee treatment.  We're now looking at a September 2008 wedding in Lincoln - venue and exact date TBC in the next couple of weeks.  Big thanks to easyworld for bringing us together :o)

In other news, I am now an uncle after my sister gave birth to Will James Coster on the 11th December.  Will was born with a full head of black hair (that must have tickled!) and weighted in at 7lbs 15 oz.  As you can imagine, he was centre of attention over Xmas.

No other news of interest to anyone else so Happy New Year to all.

It's now official: I am being seconded in to the vacant Senior Finance Manager post here at Leeds Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust.  It will be for 1 year initially but if I meet all the development targets then there is a good chance that it will become permanent.  Even if it doesn't, it is 1 year of extra money and invaluable work experience at a higher management level which would be great if I was to apply for another job at the end of the secondment.  Only problem is that it will be a lot more work which means some sacrifices will have to be made... more news on that in the coming weeks.

(In case you are wondering, which you probably aren't, at the end of the years secondment I would go back to a Finance Manager role in the Trust if the Senior Finance Manager post wasn't made permanent).

OMG!!!!! I just found a DVD of one of my favourite films as a kid - "Mad Monster Party". I doubt most of you will know it as it is very rare and was last shown on TV about 20 years ago. You have no idea how happy I am about finding this, I just hope it is as good as I remember it cos I adored it as a kid :o) For anyone who is interested, you can find some info on the film here and here.

Everything is fine here right now, only 15 more working days after today until my Floridian holiday. T'will soon be here :o)  Booked all the park tickets last night, including tickets to Mickey's 'Not So Scary Halloween Party' at Magic Kingdom - sounds like my kind of Halloween!

My sisters wedding went perfectly at the weekend, everyone enjoyed it and the weather was great.  Basically you couldn't have wished for things to go better.  My minimal Usher duties went okay, all I had to do was direct people to their seats for the ceremony and the meal - even I can manage that!  And even I had to admit that my little sister looked stunning in her wedding dress.  She's no longer that annoying little red head, she's a grown woman and now she's somebodies wife.  Shit!  I sound like my Dad!!!

Thankfully, many relatives left me pretty much alone for most of the day aside from the 'How are you?' and 'Where are you living now' polite conversations.  I got away with just 4 people asking me "So when is it your turn to get hitched?".  I resisted the urge to say "A fucking long time away!"

My thoughts go out to my dear friend Dani (she knows why).

I miss my kitties and wish they were here playing in my office.  At least I see them again in 3 hours :o)

That's enough bollocks for now.

<lj-cut text="A survey cut for the benefit of everyone who doesn't really care">

LAYER ONE
-- Name: Scott
-- Birthdate: 25th April 1975
-- Birthplace: Lincoln
-- Current Location: Leeds
-- Eye Color: Blue
-- Hair Color: Blonde-y brown
-- Height: 5 foot 9 inches
-- Righty or Lefty: Righty
-- Zodiac Sign: Taurus

LAYER TWO
-- Your heritage: I recently found our my ancestors are a very mixed bunch - English, Scottish, Irish, Swedish, and a couple of others I can't remember at the moment
-- The shoes you wore today: Boring black work shoes
-- Your weakness: Bad Taste Bears
-- Your fears: Spiders, heights, deep water
-- Your perfect pizza: Chicken
-- Goal you'd like to achieve: Finding a girlfriend

LAYER THREE
-- Your most overused phrase online: *hugs*
-- Your thoughts first waking up: Oh bollocks, time to get up and go to work
-- Your best physical feature: My butt apparently, or my eyes - take your pick depending on how dirty minded you are
-- Your bedtime: usually between midnight and 1am
-- Your most missed memory: Being in a relationship

LAYER FOUR
-- Pepsi or Coke: Coke
-- McDonald's or Burger King: If there were absolutely no other food choices available ... Burger King
-- Single or group dates: Single
-- Adidas or Nike: couldn't give a toss either way
-- Lipton Ice Tea or Nestea: Ick, neither
-- Chocolate or vanilla: Chocolate
-- Cappuccino or coffee: Double ick, definitely neither

LAYER FIVE
-- smoke: Never have, never will
-- cuss swear: FAR too fucking much
-- Sing: To myself
-- Take a shower everyday: Yep
-- Have a crush(es): Not at the moment
-- Want to go to college: Nope, and never really wanted to when I was that age
-- Like high school: Not really
-- Want to get married: Still not sold on the concept but maybe my sisters imminent wedding might change my views
-- Believe in yourself: Rarely
-- Get motion sickness: Only if I try and read as a passenger in the car or go on a motion control ride
-- Think you're attractive: Despite what Dani and Sophie tell me, so many years of being ignored by women tells me I ain't
-- Think you're a health freak: Ha ha ha, no
-- Get along with your parents: Yes
-- Like thunderstorms: Not at 3am in the morning when I am asleep
-- Play an instrument: No and I sooooo wish I could

LAYER SIX: In the past month...
-- Drank alcohol: Yes
-- Smoked: No
-- Done a drug: No
-- Had Sex: No
-- Made Out: No
-- Gone on a date: If only *sigh*
-- Gone to the mall?: Yes
-- Eaten an entire box of Oreos: No 
-- Eaten sushi: No
-- Been on stage: No
-- Been dumped: Need a g/f first to get dumped!
-- Gone skating: No
-- Made homemade cookies: No but Sophie has and they were delicious
-- Gone skinny dipping: Only in the shower
-- Dyed your hair: No
-- Stolen anything: Not to my recollection 

LAYER SEVEN: Ever..
-- Played a game that required removal of clothing: No, far too self concious
-- If so, was it mixed company: n/a
-- Been trashed or extremely intoxicated: Yep ... damn vodka!
-- Been caught "doing something": Thankfully not
-- Been called a tease: I seriously doubt it
-- Tried to pee standing up: I am a man, what do you think ...
-- Gotten beaten up: Been shoved about
-- Shoplifted: Not intentionally
-- Changed who you were to fit in: No but I probably should have occassionally

LAYER EIGHT
-- Age you hope to be married: If I am converted to the concept then before I am dead
-- Numbers and Names of Children: 2-3 - I like Jack and Dylan, not sure about girls names
-- Describe your dream wedding: No fucking religion and hymns!
-- How do you want to die: Painlessly or doing something I love
-- Where you want to go to college: n/a
-- What do you want to be when you grow up: In love
-- What country would you most like to visit: That I haven't already visited ... for some reason I was thinking about Iceland this morning, no idea why

LAYER NINE: In a guy/girl..
-- Best eye color?: No preference
-- Best hair color?: No preference but most of my ex's had dark brown hair
-- Short or long hair: Again, no preference
-- Height: Any comfortable kissing/hugging height is fine
-- Best weight: 8 stone 4 oz ... joking, anything as long as it is not anorexic (sp?) or obese
-- Best articles of clothing: anything flattering ... or a nice pair of tight-around-the-bum jeans ;o)
-- Best first date location: Gig or the cinema
-- Best first kiss location: At her door after a lovely date 

LAYER TEN
-- Number of drugs taken illegally: None ... no, really!
-- Number of people I could trust with my life: 5 I think
-- Number of CDs that I own: Too many ... hundreds
-- Number of piercings: 0
-- Number of tattoos: 0
-- Number of times my name has appeared in the newspaper?: None that I am aware of
-- Number of scars on my body: One on my left hand
-- Number of things in my past that I regret: Too many to list

</lj-cut>

It has been a frustrating few days since Saturday, not having any time to read the new Harry Potter book and trying to avoid anyone I know who reads the books. Plus I stayed off virtually all websites, message boards and LJ/Bloggers in case someone accidentally or deliberately let slip who died and who the HBP was. Thankfully it worked and at about 2.30am this morning I finally finished it!

I thoroughly enjoyed the book and what it lacked in expected action it made up for with explanations and exciting new threads for book 7.  Of course, people may still be reading the book so I wont name any characters but my chief suspect for who dies turned out to be correct but the HPB was a complete surprise.  Shame it is probably going to be at least 2 years before the final book is out.

In other news, I had a delightful weekend first in Stoke with Sophie's family and then back at my house with my parents where I cooked another successful roast dinner.

Things seem okay in my world at the moment if a little dull.  Perhaps a girlfriend would liven things up ... any volunteers? ;o)
